articles.headline: A Window Opens on Pay for Bosses
articles.snippet: It looks like disclosure rules that take effect with this year’s proxies from big companies will provide the most accurate view ever.
articles.abstract: It looks like disclosure rules that take effect with this year’s proxies from big companies will provide the most accurate view ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is it possible that shareholders will finally get a reliable view of what the bosses are getting paid? And that it will come this spring?

articles.headline: Intel’s Bet on Innovation Pays Off in Faster Chips
articles.snippet: Intel has used its hefty pile of cash to advance its manufacturing prowess and technology while rival chip makers have struggled to stay afloat.
articles.abstract: Intel has used its hefty pile of cash to advance its manufacturing prowess and technology while rival chip makers have struggled to stay afloat.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  At about this time last year, Intel’s board decided to invest $7 billion in new chip plants in Oregon, Arizona and New Mexico.

articles.headline: In Power Push, Movement Sees Base in G.O.P.
articles.snippet: First fueled by anti-establishment anger, Tea Party activists are now trying to take over the establishment.
articles.abstract: First fueled by anti-establishment anger, Tea Party activists are now trying to take over the establishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOLLAND, Pa.  The Tea Party movement ignited a year ago, fueled by anti-establishment anger. Now, Tea Party activists are trying to take over the establishment, ground up.

articles.headline: After Google’s Stand on China, U.S. Treads Lightly
articles.snippet: The difficulty of proving that the Chinese government was behind a cyberattack has frozen the U.S. response.
articles.abstract: The difficulty of proving that the Chinese government was behind a cyberattack has frozen the U.S. response.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  Last month, when Google engineers at their sprawling campus in Silicon Valley began to suspect that Chinese intruders were breaking into private Gmail accounts, the company began a secret counteroffensive.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and John Markoff

articles.headline: Executive Leaps to Leno’s Defense
articles.snippet: The battle in the late-night wars got louder Thursday as a top NBC executive struck back against on-air attacks by Conan O’Brien and David Letterman on Jay Leno.
articles.abstract: The battle in the late-night wars got louder Thursday as a top NBC executive struck back against on-air attacks by Conan O’Brien and David Letterman on Jay Leno.
articles.lead_paragraph: PASADENA, Calif.  The verbal battle in the late-night wars got louder Thursday as a top NBC executive struck back against on-air attacks on the network’s once and future “Tonight Show” host Jay Leno.

articles.headline: Patience Wears Thin as Desperation Grows
articles.snippet: Aid workers struggled to deliver supplies to survivors increasingly desperate for food and clean water.
articles.abstract: Aid workers struggled to deliver supplies to survivors increasingly desperate for food and clean water.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  As tension rose here in the battered Haitian capital, relief workers scrambled on Friday to deliver desperately needed food, water and medical care, recover survivors still trapped in the rubble and collect thousands of decaying bodies from the streets.

articles.headline: JPMorgan Chase Earns $11.7 Billion
articles.snippet: The banking giant also earmarked $26.9 billion for its workers, much of which will now be paid out as bonuses.
articles.abstract: The banking giant also earmarked $26.9 billion for its workers, much of which will now be paid out as bonuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase kicked off what is expected to be a robust  and controversial  reporting season for the nation’s banks on Friday with news that its profit and pay for 2009 soared.
